report_row_1_inspection_text: Added if the item cost is high relative to take home pay
repairability_description_key:
Repairability of a purchase is a relatively modern consideration, particularly in consumer electronics. 30 or 40 years ago, it was unimaginable you wouldn’t be able to access the inside of the product you bought.

Nowadays, it’s commonpace for purchases to be almost impossible to repair without proprietary equipment. For some, this isn’t an issue at all, whilst for others, is a dealbreaker.
longevity_description_key:
How long an item stays useful. Will it break in a year due to poor materials, poor workmanship or planned obsolescence? 

Products with poor longevity are not only disappointing for the consumer but have a significant effect on the environment.
attributes_selectable_group_icon_subhead: Select an icon to learn more
investability_description_key:
Most items we purchase are worth significantly less as soon as we open them. Other items grow in value the longer we hold on to them.

Investability looks at the likelihood of every receiving a positive return on selling the item further down the line
health_description_key:
The things we buy can have dramatic effects on our physical, mental and emotional health. 

Whilst it is often a question of how we use a product (think of a smartphone) that determines whether the effect is positive or negative, some products are intrinsically more health-oriented than others.
environment_description_key:
Many consumer goods have negative effects on the environment. The causes of these are multifaceted. From the materials used in the devices, to energy consumption, to the carbon costs of transporting goods across countries.

Some companies are starting to offset the environmental costs of creating their products by implementing initiatives that are environmentally friendly.
onboarding_explanation_message_1: It measures a product based on {purchase_attributes_count} key attributes
detailed_summary_description_left_bar: The left bar of the graph. The {purchase_item_name} category has {attribute_evaluation_result_description_with_article} {attribute_name} score
size_description_key:
How big or small an item can affect the cognitive load of owning it. If something is very big, it can become difficult to offload, becoming a 'white elephant'. 

Whilst smaller items are usually psychologically less of a burden, it's easy for this items to go in junk drawers or similar, never to see the light of day again.
onboarding_explanation_message_2: And provides purchasing advice based on what's important to you
evaluation_unit_confirmation_message: The {model_name} will be evaluated considering what’s meaningful to you. You’ll receive a report and purchasing advice
user_preferences_attributes_select_title: What’s important to you when considering a new purchase?
detailed_summary_description_right_bar: The right bar of the graph. Looks at your preferences and determines the effect of the {attribute_evaluation_result_description} on your result below
